feed.title: Organized Family
feed.subtitle: Helping bring order to your chaos

entry.title: 097: Children: Flexible Thinking
entry.content:
This week we talk about a technique positive people have that makes them resilient when changes happen.

You can get the full show notes by subscribing to our newsletter at http://www.organizedfamily.co/. Not only will you get the show notes, but you will also get access to tools that can help you organize trips, have more meaningful conversations at the dinner table and some sample chore charts you can use in your home.

Podcast: Play in new window | Download (Duration: 12:41 — 13.7MB)

Subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Android | RSS

entry.title: 096: Personal: Theming Time Blocks
entry.content:
This week we discuss why theming is, why it is helpful and different ways to apply it to months, weeks and days and different theme ideas for various time blocks.

You can get the full show notes by subscribing to our newsletter at http://www.organizedfamily.co/. entry.title: 093: Self: Personal Connections
entry.content:
In this week’s episode, we discuss what you can do to keep track of important facts on people you interact with, how to organize them and some tips on when you should record them.

entry.title: 092: Home: Meal Sharing
entry.content:
One of the hardest things about preparing meals is coming up with an idea. There are times when even that doesn’t help because nothing sounds appealing. Yet there is a way around that: Sharing meals with others.

A couple of years ago our family got together with some other families in the neighborhood and began sharing meal ideas and making them together. In this weeks episode, we discuss how to organize a meal sharing group, some of the motivations behind starting one and what important questions you need to address before getting together in a meal sharing group.

You can get the full show notes by subscribing to our newsletter at http://www.organizedfamily.co/. Not only will you get the show notes, but you will also get access to tools that can help you organize trips, have more meaningful conversations at the dinner table and some sample chore charts you can use in your home.

Podcast: Play in new window | Download (Duration: 19:21 — 19.7MB)

Subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Android | RSS

Please follow and like us:
entry.summary: One of the hardest things about preparing meals is coming up with an idea. There are times when even that doesn’t help because nothing sounds appealing. Yet there is a way around that: Sharing meals with others.

entry.title: 090: Finances: Talking With Children About Finances

link.title: 090: Finances: Talking With Children About Finances

entry.content:
Next to the birds and the bees topic, the scariest thing to talk to your kids about is money. Learn how to make it easy in today’s podcast.

You can get the full show notes by subscribing to our newsletter at http://www.organizedfamily.co/. Not only will you get the show notes, but you will also get access to tools that can help you organize trips, have more meaningful conversations at the dinner table and some sample chore charts you can use in your home.

entry.title: 089: Family: Giving Back
entry.content:
Saving money and organizing things is all well and good, but the activity that can bring some of the greatest happiness into your life and the lives of your family is sharing what you have and know with others. This week we discuss various ways you can give back to those around you.

Podcast: Play in new window | Download (14.6MB)

Subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Android | RSS

Please follow and like us:
entry.summary: Saving money and organizing things is all well and good, but the activity that can bring some of the greatest happiness into your life and the lives of your family is sharing what you have and know with others. This week we discuss various ways you can give back to those around you.

entry.title: 088: Finances: Estate Planning
entry.content:
Contrary to popular opinions, estate planning is not just for old people! This week we discuss why it’s important to have an estate plan even as a young couple and how you can get started.

Podcast: Play in new window | Download (13.5MB)

Subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Android | RSS

Please follow and like us:
entry.summary: Contrary to popular opinions, estate planning is not just for old people! This week we discuss why it’s important to have an estate plan even as a young couple and how you can get started.
